result.execSummary:
The defendant Regina L Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Regina L Mitchell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Regina L Mitchell was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 10.26.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 10.26.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
BAIL IS TO BE APPLIED TO ALL COSTS AND DNA SURCHARGES (REMAINING BALANCE IS TO BE RETURNED TO THE PERSON WHO POSTED BAIL).
**01-18-17/Order - Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program.
The Court ordered the defendant's operating privileges suspended for 5 YEARS.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess weapons, firearms or body armor. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Decision And Order Denying Motion To Modify Sentence - defendant's motion for sentence modification is denied; it is further ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state that the defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to the parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (41 pages) commencing AUGUST 27,2015 received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet
9/9/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

The court ordered 158 days credit.
The defendant is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
BAIL IS TO BE APPLIED TO ALL COSTS AND DNA SURCHARGES (REMAINING BALANCE IS TO BE RETURNED TO THE PERSON WHO POSTED BAIL).
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

As to COUNT 2- On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed.

As to COUNT 3- Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Regina L Mitchell in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State withdrew the amended information previously filed on 6/30/15. Court proceeded with the Original Information previously filed on 4/6/15. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if she is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, she could be deported, excluded from admission to her country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court vacated the jury trial date of 8/17/15. 
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

15RM033312  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-10-2015
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNTS 1, 2 & 3 remain the same.

COUNT 4- Homicide by Intoxicated Use of a Vehicle (Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance), contrary to sec. 940.09(1)(am), 939.50(3)(d) Wis. Stats., a Class D Felony. 

Court will conduct the arraignment on the next court date.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Parties anticipate this matter will resolve and request an additional final pretrial date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/17/15. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Regina L Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defendant not produced for today's hearing due to logistical issues. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties do not object to a short adjournment. Defense counsel previously filed a bail motion and requests a bail hearing be set. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/17/15. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Regina L Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defense has received discovery but has not received an offer from the State and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 5/01/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Defense counsel will be filing a bail motion. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Regina L Mitchell in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Regina L Mitchell in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Regina L Mitchell in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant did not retain private counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  State Public Defender's Office will have someone present on the next scheduled court appearance date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Regina L Mitchell in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Regina L Mitchell in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
